14
15#ifndef ISC_EVENT_H
16#define ISC_EVENT_H 1
17
18/*! \file isc/event.h */
19
20#include <isc/lang.h>
21#include <isc/types.h>
22
23/*****
24 ***** Events.
25 *****/
26
27typedef void (*isc_eventdestructor_t)(isc_event_t *);
28
29#define ISC_EVENT_COMMON(ltype) \
30 size_t ev_size; \
31 unsigned int ev_attributes; \
32 void * ev_tag; \
33 isc_eventtype_t ev_type; \
34 isc_taskaction_t ev_action; \
35 void * ev_arg; \
36 void * ev_sender; \
37 isc_eventdestructor_t ev_destroy; \
38 void * ev_destroy_arg; \
39 ISC_LINK(ltype) ev_link; \
40 ISC_LINK(ltype) ev_ratelink
41
42/*%
43 * Attributes matching a mask of 0x000000ff are reserved for the task library's
44 * definition. Attributes of 0xffffff00 may be used by the application
45 * or non-ISC libraries.
46 */
47#define ISC_EVENTATTR_NOPURGE 0x00000001
48
49/*%
50 * The ISC_EVENTATTR_CANCELED attribute is intended to indicate
51 * that an event is delivered as a result of a canceled operation
52 * rather than successful completion, by mutual agreement
53 * between the sender and receiver. It is not set or used by
54 * the task system.
55 */
56#define ISC_EVENTATTR_CANCELED 0x00000002
57
58#define ISC_EVENT_INIT(event, sz, at, ta, ty, ac, ar, sn, df, da) \
59do { \
60 (event)->ev_size = (sz); \
61 (event)->ev_attributes = (at); \
62 (event)->ev_tag = (ta); \
63 (event)->ev_type = (ty); \
64 (event)->ev_action = (ac); \
65 (event)->ev_arg = (ar); \
66 (event)->ev_sender = (sn); \
67 (event)->ev_destroy = (df); \
68 (event)->ev_destroy_arg = (da); \
69 ISC_LINK_INIT((event), ev_link); \
70 ISC_LINK_INIT((event), ev_ratelink); \
71} while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
72
73/*%
74 * This structure is public because "subclassing" it may be useful when
75 * defining new event types.
76 */
77struct isc_event {
78 ISC_EVENT_COMMON(struct isc_event);
79};
80
81#define ISC_EVENTTYPE_FIRSTEVENT 0x00000000
82#define ISC_EVENTTYPE_LASTEVENT 0xffffffff
83
84#define ISC_EVENT_PTR(p) ((isc_event_t **)(void *)(p))
85
86ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
87
88isc_event_t *
89isc_event_allocate(isc_mem_t *mctx, void *sender, isc_eventtype_t type,
90 isc_taskaction_t action, void *arg, size_t size);
91isc_event_t *
92isc_event_constallocate(isc_mem_t *mctx, void *sender, isc_eventtype_t type,
93 isc_taskaction_t action, const void *arg, size_t size);
94/*%<
95 * Allocate an event structure.
96 *
97 * Allocate and initialize in a structure with initial elements
98 * defined by:
99 *
100 * \code
101 * struct {
102 * ISC_EVENT_COMMON(struct isc_event);
103 * ...
104 * };
105 * \endcode
106 *
107 * Requires:
108 *\li 'size' >= sizeof(struct isc_event)
109 *\li 'action' to be non NULL
110 *
111 * Returns:
112 *\li a pointer to a initialized structure of the requested size.
113 *\li NULL if unable to allocate memory.
114 */
115
116void
117isc_event_free(isc_event_t **);
118
119ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
120
121#endif /* ISC_EVENT_H */
122
